body:
I assume you don't want to use `--drive-skip-shortcuts` which will skip all shortcuts?

A `--drive-skip-dangling-shortcuts` option which didn't show dangling shortcuts in the listing at all would be easy enough to implement - is that what you mean?

> Another solution could be change error to warning in case of dangling shortcuts when --drive-skip-dangling-shortcuts is used.

Rclone only gives the error when the dangling shortcut is opened for read.

Rclone would then have to supply the contents of the shortcut so make an empty file or something. I don't think that will work very well.

rename.from: Skip or suppress errors for dangling shortcuts
rename.to: drive: Skip or suppress errors for dangling shortcuts

body:
Hello @ncw,
  thank you for your answer.
  

> A --drive-skip-dangling-shortcuts option which didn't show dangling shortcuts in the listing at all would be easy enough to implement - is that what you mean?

Yes, that might be enough for me.

> Rclone would then have to supply the contents of the shortcut so make an empty file or something. I don't think that will work very well.

I think that is better to skip dangling shortcuts at all without creating empty files but I'd like to have a log of all skipped shortcuts, if possible.

  Thank you,
    Filippo.

Give this a go

[v1.58.0-beta.5977.1938ca218.fix-5948-drive-skip-dangling](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5948-drive-skip-dangling/v1.58.0-beta.5977.1938ca218.fix-5948-drive-skip-dangling/) on branch [fix-5948-drive-skip-dangling](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5948-drive-skip-dangling) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

It implements the --drive-skip-dangling-shortcuts flag which doesn't show dangling shortcuts in the listing. It will log them as it does at the moment.

Thank you very much @ncw!
I'll try this fix as soon as possibile.
Let me know if it works for you, then I'll merge it if it does :-)
@filippobottega did that beta work for you?

@ncw I'm really sorry but I have deleted my dangling shortcuts and I'm not able to test it for the moment.
Do you know a way to create a  dangling shortcut from scratch?
@filippobottega one way to do this is to ask someone else to create a shortcut to a document that you don't have access to - it'll behave the same way as a shortcut to a deleted document.

@ncw one thing I noticed is that the new log line only prints out the name of the file, which can make it difficult to locate if the drive contains other files by the same name. Could the log include the path to the file as well?

This would be similar to the existing logs for "duplicate object...ignoring", which print the path to the file.

Doesn't works:

NOTICE: Dangling shortcut ""Documento di test (Cancellare)"" detected"
"Transferred:   	    2.986 MiB / 2.986 MiB, 100%, 7.562 KiB/s, ETA 0s"
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
2022/02/21 09:55:04 Failed to sync: failed to open source object: can't read dangling shortcut
Exit code: 1

@benthorner wrote:
> one thing I noticed is that the new log line only prints out the name of the file, which can make it difficult to locate if the drive contains other files by the same name. Could the log include the path to the file as well?
> 
> This would be similar to the existing logs for "duplicate object...ignoring", which print the path to the file.

I had a go at doing this, but unfortunately the dangling shortcuts are resolved before we know the name of the directory (directories are addressed by ID not name in the google drive protocol). At the point the shortcut is resolved we only know the directory ID, and that isn't yet in the directory ID cache because the listing of that directory hasn't completed yet so we can't look up the name.

So, perhaps surprisingly, its annoyingly hard to add the path in the log message!
